blog.name: bboiseux
blog.title: Left of Empty
blog.description: Writing and Critical Role, sometimes other things. My AO3 | All the love to my fellow fic writers!

title: Our Lives Are Our Gifts
body:
Ten years later, each member of the Mighty Nein finds their ending.  Yasha decides to tell Molly about it.

Reading Time: abt 13 mins

“Hello, Molly,” say Yasha, taking a seat in the warm grass next to her knapsack, “It has been a long time.”

Above, the sky was a brilliant blue.  Even the clouds seemed to glow with an inner white light as they drifted slowly above.  The air was cooler here, just outside the northern reaches of the Empire, but a warm breeze blew in from the south and carried with it the smell of wet grass and newborn dirt.  In the summer, when the fields were lush and the travel on the road was constant, Yasha imagined the view from the hill was quite pleasant.

It had been ten years since they had last seen each other and Yasha wore those years with pride.  Her hair had grown even longer.  Even looped three times through the simple silver rings Beau had given her five years ago her hair hung in thick locks down her back and to the side.  Wearing to the side made it easier to access the simple sword strapped to her back.  For the times when its immense size and its owner’s matching height were not enough to dissuade potential attackers.  Yasha ran her fingers along her face as she considered her next words, tracing the heavy nicks and thick scars that decorated her skin.  The familiar map of her life.  She smiled, slow and heavy, but a smile nonetheless.

“You have a lot to catch up on.  Caduceus—“ She paused, sifting through her memories.  “–You never met Caduceus.   He–you would have liked him.  You would have liked his tea.”

Read the rest on AO3

summary: Pikelan does not get enough recognition for its preeminent slow burn. That was over 500 hours of tentative ill-fated overtures...
body: Pikelan does not get enough recognition for its preeminent slow burn. That was over 500 hours of tentative ill-fated overtures and ships passing in the night with canon endgame sneaking through in the literal last half hour.

summary:
The love I have for campaign 1 is so much different for the love I have for campaign 2.
The only way I can describe it is...
body:
The love I have for campaign 1 is so much different for the love I have for campaign 2.

The only way I can describe it is campaign 1 is full of nostalgia like a childhood home. And campaign 2 is the first house you buy to build your life in.

summary: So I’ve been debating with myself as to whether or not to start writing Critical Role reader-insert fanfiction, as there doesn’t...
question: So I’ve been debating with myself as to whether or not to start writing Critical Role reader-insert fanfiction, as there doesn’t seem to be a whole lot of it anywhere that I can find. Do you know of anyone other than your lovely self who has written such things? I’m about at episode 25 of the Mighty Nein campaign and kinda have fallen in love with both Molly and Caleb and wish to write for them, but I’m a little hesitant due to lack of fics for them. ^^
answer:
I actually started writing x reader fics because there wasn’t any. Write what you wanna read is kind of my mantra.

Unfortunately I haven’t found any other reader fics for Critical role. But precisely because of that I definitely think you should go for it! The amount of readers that message me definitely prove there is a want for x reader content.

Go for it! 😁😁😁

reblog.comment:
I actually started writing x reader fics because there wasn’t any. Write what you wanna read is kind of my mantra.

Unfortunately I haven’t found any other reader fics for Critical role. But precisely because of that I definitely think you should go for it! The amount of readers that message me definitely prove there is a want for x reader content.

summary: I was curious because I thought that the exact mechanism of how Fjord's ship sank was a little too extensive and personal for...
body: I was curious because I thought that the exact mechanism of how Fjord’s ship sank was a little too extensive and personal for him to have shared with Avantika in the detail that she talked about it and twisted it at the trial, so I went back and listened to part of ep 40 when he tells her about Vandrin, and guess what. He never told her ANY of that shit. The extent of what he said to her was that he had been shipwrecked during a storm, and then she was able to fish out the fact that Vandrin was his captain. Now it’s obviously possible that Matt just forgot this–which I dont mind, honestly, because the absolute gut punch that was Avantika twisting what is probably the most horrible moment of Fjord’s life to make HIM the guilty party was AMAZING–but it’s interesting bc if it wasnt just a memory slip that means it’s possible that Avantika was involved in more of this shit than she let on. Maybe she was working with Sabien to get the orb from Vandrin or something and things went sideways. Maybe she knew more about Fjord than she let on. Either way I’m VERY curious as to how she knew about this if it was an intentional statement by Matt.

Either way I’m VERY curious as to how she knew about this if it was an intentional statement by Matt.

Now it’s obviously possible that Matt just forgot this–which I dont mind, honestly, because the absolute gut punch that was Avantika twisting what is probably the most horrible moment of Fjord’s life to make HIM the guilty party was AMAZING–but it’s interesting bc if it wasnt just a memory slip that means it’s possible that Avantika was involved in more of this shit than she let on. summary: I saw your tags on that post about not being sure of your faves, so I wanted to share mine lol. I've decided that my top three...
question: I saw your tags on that post about not being sure of your faves, so I wanted to share mine lol. I've decided that my top three Vox Machina episodes are: 1. Episode 114 (duh). 2. Episode 99 (I cried like a baby over Vex's perception check). 3. Episode 33 (Vaxleth!). I will give Episode 31 an honorable mention though, BECAUSE TRICERATOPS-SCANLAN.
answer:
Wow, I suck at answering asks. I’ve kept telling myself I would think on it and come up with my own list (finally), but that hasn’t happened. But I’ll answer anyway. Like you said 114 is a completely necessary episode to have on the list. But I feel like I have moments or battles, more than episodes as favorites. Like Scanlan the Triceratops, Grog’s kill on Kevdak, or Vex’s conversation with Saundor, Percy’s resurrection (and Vexy? Perc'ahlia? I’m blanking on the ship name), the Larkin/Raishan whole relationship-alliance-thing, Vex’s perception check in 99 like you said, and there are probably a bunch of others, but if I can’t think of them now, they’re clearly not my favorites.

Though as I rewatch I am reminded of things I forgot and I fall in love with the show all over again.

blog.description: Hi, I'm Clara and this is my Critical Role appreciation blog. If you don't want to see spoilers or my gifsets or/and rambling when the episodes are airing live, please block the tag "clara is watching cr right now". I also tag all of my gifsets with "cr spoilers" and "critical role spoilers". Icon by juliachiarelli and header by greyopal (both with permission).
